newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch cuts '96 EMU deficit to about 1.9 pct of GDP.
newsitem.headline: Dutch cuts '96 EMU deficit to about 1.9 pct of GDP.

text.p: The Netherlands has further cut its 1996 Dutch EMU public sector deficit estimate to 1.9 percent from 2.1 percent, a Finance Ministry spokeswoman said on Friday.
Finance Minister Gerrit Zalm mentioned the new estimate to members of parliament on Thursday, she said, adding that it remained a provisional figure.
The Finance Ministry first lowered its 1996 EMU deficit estimate in January to 2.1 percent of GDP from the 2.6 percent forecast in September.
It said then that the 1996 EMU public sector debt estimate had been lowered to 78.5 percent of GDP from 78.8 percent in September.
Zalm did not mention a new EMU debt estimate on Thursday.
The Maastricht Treaty says a country's deficit should be below three percent of GDP and its debt below 60 percent of GDP, or declining towards that level, to qualify for EMU.
